qas.question: Which tribe did Elizabeth belong to?
Which tribe did Elisheba belong to?
Who was the third son of David and Bathsheba?
What tribe did Luke belong to?
What priestly division did Luke belong to?
Who was Zechariah's sister in law?
What tribe did Matthew belong to?

context: According to the writer of Luke, <b8_0>Mary<b8_0/> was a relative of <b6_0>Elizabeth<b6_0/>, wife of the <a0_0>priest<a0_0/> Zechariah of the priestly division of <b7_0>Abijah<b7_0/>, who was herself part of the lineage of Aaron and so of the tribe of <a1_0>Levi<a1_0/>.[Luke 1:5;1:36] Some of those who consider that the relationship with Elizabeth was on the maternal side, consider that Mary, like Joseph, to whom she was betrothed, was of the House of David and so of <b5_0>the Tribe of Judah<b5_0/>, and that the genealogy of Jesus presented in Luke 3 from <a4_0>Nathan<a4_0/>, third son of David and Bathsheba, is in fact the genealogy of Mary,[need quotation to verify] while the genealogy from Solomon given in Matthew 1 is that of Joseph. (Aaron's wife <a2_0>Elisheba<a2_0/> was of the tribe of <a3_0>Judah<a3_0/>, so all their descendants are from both <b9_0>Levi<b9_0/> and Judah.)[Num.1:7 & Ex.6:23]
